intro: Elemifera terebinthifolia, commonly known as the terebinthifolia elemifera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which consists of small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a dense, compact form. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in the spring. The plant is well adapted to cold and nutrient-poor soils, making it a hardy species found in alpine environments.
